meanings.sent1: Her uninterest in the movie was evident by her constant yawning.
meanings.sent2: The uninterest in the topic made the lecture quite boring.
meanings.sent3: His uninterest in the party led to him falling asleep in the corner.
meanings.sent4: The uninterest in the project was like a dark cloud hanging over the team.
meanings.sent5: The uninterest in her eyes was like a closed door, impossible to open.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to have no interest or concern.
meanings.sent1: The dry presentation uninterested the audience within minutes.
meanings.sent2: His monotonous voice uninterests even the most attentive listeners.
meanings.sent3: She tried to uninterest him in the new video game by talking about something else.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive tasks uninterest the employees, leading to decreased productivity.
meanings.sent5: The lack of creativity in the design uninterests potential buyers.
